props.docs: If `true` the bal-app can be used with header, main and footer. The footer will then be sticky to the bottom.

props.name: bottomRounded
props.docs: If `true` the bottom corners get rounded

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the button.

props.name: download
props.docs:
This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to
it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

props.name: allowedDates
props.docs: Callback to determine which date in the datepicker should be selectable.

props.name: balTabindex
props.docs: The tabindex of the control.

props.name: closeOnSelect
props.docs: Closes the datepicker dropdown after selection

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

props.name: defaultDate
props.docs: The date to defines where the datepicker popup starts. The prop accepts ISO 8601 date strings (YYYY-MM-DD).

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true` the component is diabled.

props.name: expanded
props.docs: If `true` the component uses the whole width.

props.name: inverted
props.docs: Set this to `true` when the component is placed on a dark background.

props.name: locale
props.docs: Define the locale of month and day names.

props.name: max
props.docs:
The maximum datetime allowed. Value must be a date string
following the
[ISO 8601 datetime format standard](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime),
`1996-12-19`. The format does not have to be specific to an exact
datetime. For example, the maximum could just be the year, such as `1994`.
Defaults to the end of this year.

props.name: maxYearProp
props.docs: Latest year available for selection

props.name: min
props.docs:
The minimum datetime allowed. Value must be a date string
following the
[ISO 8601 datetime format standard](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime),
such as `1996-12-19`. The format does not have to be specific to an exact
datetime. For example, the minimum could just be the year, such as `1994`.
Defaults to the beginning of the year, 100 years ago from today.

props.name: minYearProp
props.docs: Earliest year available for selection

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: The text to display when the select is empty.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true` the use can only select a date.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true` the attribute required is added to the native input.

props.name: triggerIcon
props.docs: If `true` the datepicker only open on click of the icon

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the form field, which accepts ISO 8601 date strings (YYYY-MM-DD).

props.docs:
Make the visual style mimic a specific heading level.
This option allows you to make e.g. h1 visually look like h3,
but still keep it h1 in the markup.

props.docs: If `true` the icon rotates like for a loading spinner

props.name: size
props.docs: Defines the size of the icon.

props.name: svg
props.docs: Svg content.

props.name: turn
props.docs: If `true` the icon is rotated 180deg

props.name: accept
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `"file"`, then this attribute will indicate the types of files that the server accepts, otherwise it will be ignored. The value must be a comma-separated list of unique content type specifiers.

props.name: autoComplete
props.docs: The autocomplete attribute specifies whether or not an input field should have autocomplete enabled.

props.name: autocapitalize
props.docs:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

props.name: autocomplete
props.docs: Indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

props.name: autocorrect
props.docs: Whether auto correction should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text value.

props.name: autofocus
props.docs: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

props.name: balTabindex
props.docs: The tabindex of the control.

props.name: clickable
props.docs: If `true` the input gets a clickable cursor style

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `balChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

props.name: decimal
props.docs: Defins the allowed decimal points for the `number-input`.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true` the input is disabled

props.name: inputmode
props.docs:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

props.name: inverted
props.docs: If `true` this component can be placed on dark background

props.name: max
props.docs: The maximum value, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

props.name: maxLength
props.docs: Defines the max length of the value.

props.name: min
props.docs: The minimum value, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

props.name: minLength
props.docs: Defines the min length of the value.

props.name: multiple
props.docs: If `true`, the user can enter more than one value. This attribute applies when the type attribute is set to `"email"` or `"file"`, otherwise it is ignored.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: numberInput
props.docs: If `true` on mobile device the number keypad is active

props.name: pattern
props.docs: A regular expression that the value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, `"date"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored. When the type attribute is `"date"`, `pattern` will only be used in browsers that do not support the `"date"` input type natively. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/date for more information.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

props.name: spellcheck
props.docs: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

props.name: suffix
props.docs: Adds a suffix the the inputvalue after blur.

props.name: type
props.docs: Defines the type of the input (text, number, email ...).

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the input.

methods.docs: Returns the native `<input>` element used under the hood.

methods.docs:
Sets focus on the native `input` in `bal-input`. Use this method instead of the global
`input.focus()`.

events.docs: Emitted when the link element has clicked

props.name: expanded
props.docs: If `true` the table has a full width

props.name: action
props.docs: If `true` a acation button is added to the right

props.name: actionLabel
props.docs: Label for the action button

props.name: clickable
props.docs: If `true` the tabs or steps can be clicked.

props.name: expanded
props.docs: If `true` the field expands over the whole width.

props.name: interface
props.docs: Defines the layout of the tabs.

props.name: rounded
props.docs: If you want the rounded tab style.

methods.name: select
methods.docs: Go to tab with the given value

events.docs: Emitted when the action button has clicked
Emitted when the changes has finished.

props.name: closable
props.docs: The theme type of the tag. Given by bulma our css framework.

props.name: color
props.docs: The theme type of the tag. Given by bulma our css framework.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the tag element

events.docs: Emitted when the input got clicked.

props.name: bold
props.docs: If `true` the text is bold

props.name: color
props.docs: Defines the color of the text.

props.name: small
props.docs: If `true` the text has a small size

props.name: autocapitalize
props.docs: Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

props.name: autofocus
props.docs: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

props.name: balTabindex
props.docs: The tabindex of the control.

props.name: clickable
props.docs: If `true` the input gets a clickable cursor style

props.name: cols
props.docs: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer.

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionChange` event after each keystroke. This also impacts form bindings such as `ngModel` or `v-model`.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

props.name: inputmode
props.docs:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

props.name: inverted
props.docs: If `true` this component can be placed on dark background

props.name: maxLength
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: minLength
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

props.name: rows
props.docs: The number of visible text lines for the control.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the textarea.

props.name: wrap
props.docs: Indicates how the control wraps text.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.docs: Returns the native `<textarea>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs:
Sets focus on the native `textarea` in `ion-textarea`. Use this method instead of the global
`textarea.focus()`.

events.docs: Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.
Emitted when the input value has changed..
Emitted when the input has clicked.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.
Emitted when a keyboard key has pressed.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true` the button is disabled

props.name: inverted
props.docs: If `true` the timeinput can be used on blue background.

props.name: maxTime
props.docs: Latest date available for selection

props.name: minTime
props.docs: Earliest date available for selection

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the datepicker with the format `hh:mm`.

events.docs: Emitted when either the hour or minute input field loses focus.

Emitted when either the hour or the minute input has changed.
It will not be triggert if either hour or time input has never been set (i.e. "--" is selected).

props.name: color
props.docs: The theme type of the toast. Given by bulma our css framework.

props.name: duration
props.docs: The duration of the toast in milliseconds.

props.name: message
props.docs: Content message

methods.name: close
methods.docs: Closes this toast

methods.name: closeIn
methods.docs: Closes the toast after the given duration in ms

events.docs: Emitted when toast is closed
